text.section: The terms of the appointed members of the board shall be for four (4) years, dating from the beginning of the terms for which they were respectively appointed, and until their successors are appointed and qualify. As the terms of each group of members expire, the Governor shall appoint successors for terms of four (4) years and until their successors are appointed and qualify. Beginning with the appointments to be made for the terms commencing December 12, 1948, one (1) member of the first group of successor members to be appointed shall be appointed from a list of six (6) nominees consisting of three (3) names from each of the two (2) political parties polling the largest number of votes in the state at general elections submitted to the Governor by the governing body of the Kentucky Livestock Improvement Association, and beginning December 12, 1972, one (1) member of the first group shall be appointed from a list of six (6) nominees so submitted by the governing body of the Kentucky State National Farmers Organization; one (1) member of the second such group shall be appointed from a list of six (6) nominees so submitted by the governing body of the American Saddle Horse Breeders Association; and one (1) member of the third group shall be appointed from a list of six (6) nominees so submitted by the governing body of the Kentucky Farm Bureau Federation. It is the intention of the General Assembly that the political affiliation of the appointed members shall be as evenly divided as possible between the two (2) political parties polling the largest number of votes in the state at general elections.
In case of a vacancy among the appointed members of the board, the unexpired term so occurring shall be filled pursuant to the requirements and procedures for original appointments.
